734 I'm prepping a formal talk on the CIA's role in the music industry, covering all the networks, programs & partnerships of the covert influence side of USAID, NED & State Dept with record labels, streaming platforms, entertainment lawyers, A&Rs, events/tours, & artists themselves posted 2 days ago by ALT26 71 comments award share report block Mike Benz @MikeBenzCyber • 2d I'm prepping a formal talk on the CIA's role in the music industry, covering all the networks, programs & partnerships of the covert influence side of USAID, NED & State Dept with record labels, streaming platforms, entertainment lawyers, A&Rs, events/tours, & artists themselves Despa Robinson @DespaRobinson • 2d I’ve been thinking about that Mike Benz DJ Vlad interview all day.
71 comments Sort by Top Top New Worst Old Save MAGA9428 70 points 2 days ago This will be interesting. Expose the music industry’s role in promoting degeneracy given that half of mainstream music today makes that its primary mission. permalink award report block reply Viewer01 35 points 2 days ago Taylor swift has to be one. permalink parent award report block reply Dway 14 points 2 days ago She couldn’t even carry a tune when she first came out. But there’s all kinds of mystery surrounding the whole Laurel Canyon scene given half the artists who came out of there were military/intelligence brats. You ever notice how the original Mouseketeers were all normal and well adjusted kids when Walt Disney did the original Mickey Mouse Club, but a lot the kids from the revival of it for the Disney Channel are all completely mind fucked? I’m talking about the degenerate garbage that’s all about being a ni66er. permalink parent award report block reply South_Florida_Guy 18 points 2 days ago MK Ultra permalink award report block reply UCantStumpTheTrump 11 points 2 days ago There is a theory (with some credence to it) that the 'entertainment' industry deliberately glorifies murder music to keep the prison pipeline full of new inmates permalink parent award report block reply Cacciali_Via -3 points 2 days ago Ridiculous. permalink parent award report block reply Hanging_Chad 14 points 2 days ago Benz didn’t kill himself permalink award report block reply DeportThemAllForever 12 points 2 days ago I think Mike just proved that no matter how hard cia tries, no one likes country music. permalink parent award report block reply scruffyshoulders 4 points 2 days ago It's pretty interesting the two most hated genres, pop rap and pop country, are tied up in this shit. It's almost like we've subconsciously known this whole time. permalink parent award report block reply I_Love_45-70_Gov 12 points 2 days ago USAID funding has dried up, and now, for the first time since 1990 ('95?), a rap song has not been in the top 40.  🤔 permalink award report block reply booblitchutz 6 points 2 days ago Ice Ice Baby was the #1 song on the Billboard charts in the country in 1990, btw. permalink parent award report block reply MixedBlacknWhite 10 points 2 days ago I have been saying this for years!! Once I got into pop country (shush, I had to start somewhere and it's catchy) I started comparing the top song lyrics in country vs rap .. and my god there is a huge difference. but wait, there's more. So I went down a rabbit hole of "maybe it's about income disparity" and that's why the different tones in the music. Not so fast. There are many majority poor white towns in "country" areas, like W.V and KY who don't have violent crimes like they do in the equally poor majority black towns of near the same populations (and I did per capita too to make sure I got solid metrics) So how is it that two groups of people from the same income levels listen to two types of different music with wildly different messages? Is it only the people or is it something else? God, fishing, beer, friends, family first, checking in on loved ones, loves lost and loves found vs Shooting, violence, drugs, materialism, treating people like shit and a hate of law and order Fucking wild to me permalink award report block reply MuslimsWorshipSatan 4 points 2 days ago Don't neglect the genetic factor either. permalink parent award report block reply tholinz 10 points 2 days ago Good, make those Satanists squirm. permalink award report block reply Thatunknownguy 8 points 2 days ago I've never heard of this guy but I have a feeling hes somehow going to shift the blame off joggers to the CIA permalink award report block reply SwedishChainsaw2 6 points 1 day ago Benz is the one who showed how NGOs were all government funded and how the sensorship machine worked. He's good at info gathering and research. permalink parent award report block reply SenorTrumper 6 points 2 days ago They are in bed together. permalink parent award report block reply Thatunknownguy 6 points 2 days ago Literally permalink parent award report block reply ElectionMeddler 7 points 2 days ago Make music great again! No more gangsta rap, no more hot slut pop.  Let's just make enjoyable songs that we can sing with friends and family.  Give it a good beat. Good rhythm.  And good lyrics.   Give America a culture to be proud of for the next 50 years permalink award report block reply anotherviewpoint 3 points 2 days ago Go back to the standards even better, check out Artie Shaw, Tommy Dorsey, Glenn Miller and then all the players and their records like Ziggy Elman, or a whole host of others.  Its a rabbit hole of good times, warmth and musical talent. permalink parent award report block reply DonnieRamesJio 3 points 2 days ago Jack Sheldon - "I'm Just A Bill Up On Capitol Hill", also cameo'd in a lot of Dragnet episodes permalink parent award report block reply guywholikesDjtof2024 6 points 2 days ago " B b bBUT IT WAS A KONSPERACE THERIY!!!111!1! How will, or do they even think they'll ever need to/have to regain their trust to the American people? What have they done for Americans lately? permalink award report block reply SmokeyAF 6 points 2 days ago Mike Benz is awesome. permalink award report block reply gorilla_grip 5 points 2 days ago I think I heard an ex cia guy talking about this on Joe Rogan a year or so ago.  About how they influenced musical acts to speak about certain social issues to sway public opinion in other nations .  And admitted they did it in the US too. permalink award report block reply MAG_n_KAG 5 points 2 days ago Make 432 hz the standard again permalink award report block reply Obambi 5 points 2 days ago Guess who controls the music industry??! permalink award report block reply freeperjim 5 points 2 days ago Rap/HipHop is to music...as Ebonics is to the English language.
